SEARCH
Package com.screenprog.application.service

Class JsonWebTokenService

java.lang.Object
com.screenprog.application.service.JsonWebTokenService
@Service public class JsonWebTokenService extends Object
Service class responsible for generating and validating JSON Web Tokens (JWT). The JsonWebTokenService class provides methods for creating JWTs, retrieving claims, and verifying the authenticity of the tokens. The tokens are signed using an HMAC SHA-256 algorithm with a secret key.

The secret key is generated upon the instantiation of this service and remains constant for the duration of the application's runtime. The tokens generated by this service are valid for a predetermined amount of time, which can be configured as needed.

This service is typically used in conjunction with Spring Security to manage authentication and authorization in a web application.
See Also:
  • Baeldung: JSON Web Tokens
  • Baeldung: HmacSHA256

  • Method Details

    • generateToken

      public String generateToken(String username)
      Generates a json web token for the given username. The token is valid for 30 minutes.
      Parameters:
      username - the username to generate the token for.
      Returns:
      String the json web token.

    • extractUsername

      public String extractUsername(String token)
      Extracts the username from the provided JWT token.
      Parameters:
      token - the JSON Web Token from which the username is to be extracted.
      Returns:
      String the username contained in the JWT token.

    • validateToken

      public boolean validateToken(String token, org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetails userDetails)
      This method is used to validate the given JWT token against the provided UserDetails.

      It checks if the token is valid and the username contained in the token matches the username of the provided UserDetails.

      Parameters:
      token - the JSON Web Token to be validated
      userDetails - the UserDetails against which the token is to be validated
      Returns:
      boolean indicating whether the token is valid or not
      See Also:
      • extractUsername(java.lang.String)
      • isTokenExpired(java.lang.String)
